nodes.bodyText: Need help here. I don't understand why this dependency is needed here. All instrumentation modules depend on agent-tooling which depends on agent-bootstrap which depends on this opentelemetry-contrib-auto-annotations. Why this needs to be specified as test dependency? Some other tests fail because they lack this declaration. But I assumed this jar will be automatically in the classpath of tests. What don't I understand?

commit.message: Add api contrib into shaded parts of the agent
Try to separate methods dealing with different annotations

beforeCommit.message: Try to separate methods dealing with different annotations

afterCommit.message: Try to separate methods dealing with different annotations

nodes.bodyText: 👍 this helped me understand why you didn't wedge this into the existing TraceAnnotationsInstrumentation. makes sense.
I don't think we need this in BaseDecorator, maybe just (static) method in TraceDecorator?
do we want to apply trace.methods.exclude here?
I think the cause of the muzzle failures is this method. I don't think the classloader that the advice classes are applied to has bytebuddy in it's classpath
